newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk Akbank 96 real asset growth 18 pct.
newsitem.headline: Turk Akbank 96 real asset growth 18 pct.

text.p: Akbank T.A.S., one of Turkey's leading commercial banks, said its assets grew 18 percent in real terms in 1996 and its market share of loans in the banking sector firmed to 4.7 percent from previous 3.6.

"Akbank achieved a real growth of 18 percent in assets... This (growth) was specifically evident in the case of loans where market share increased to 4.7 percent from 3.6 the previous year," Akbank said in a statement.
It said the bank's "strong and reliable deposit base and high liquidity" helped to increase its market share in loans.
Akbank reported net profits of 37.8 trillion lira last year, up 157 percent from 14.7 trillion in 1995. Profit growth in real terms was 42.3 percent, the statement said.

Akbank's loans surged to 142.5 trillion lira in 1996 from 54.4 trillion the previous year and assets doubled to 467.6 trillion lira from 219.6 trillion lira. Deposits reached 334.1 trillion lira at end-1996 from 154.4 trillion a year ago.

The statement said overdue loans stood at 0.3 percent of the total loans at the end of 1996, partly due to the development of client information systems and the continuing risk averse attitude of the management.
Akbank is largely owned by industrial conglomerate Sabanci Holding and other group companies.

The statement said a total capital gain of 8.6 trillion lira from divesting partial equity stakes in non-financial group firms would be added to share capital to take advantage of exemption from corporate tax.

A plan to raise capital to 50 trillion lira from current 18 trillion by issuing one right and 0.7777 bonus for one existing share was approved at Akbank's annual meeting of shareholders and directors on March 3.
The bank will begin a 1,200 lira cash dividend payout per 1,000 lira nominal-valued share from 1996 profits on April 9.
